moves.1. e4: As fisher said, best by test.
moves.1... c5: The sicilian defense. One of the black's best answers to 1.e4
moves.2... d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 g6: The sicilian dragon which is very popular. It allows 6...Bg7 and 0-0.
moves.6. Be3 Bg7 7. f3: to be followed by Qd2, 0-0-0, Bh6, pawn storm on the kingside. If 7.Qd2 immediately, black can play 7...Ng4.
moves.7... Nc6 8. Qd2 O-O 9. Bc4: Sicilian Defense , Dragon Variation , Yugoslav Attack. Now black usually plays 9...Bd7 or Qa5.
moves.9... Bd7 10. h4: Safer is 0-0-0 which is the book move, but this move is also good.
moves.10... Ne5 11. Bb3: Moving the bishop to a safe square and still controlling a2-g8 diagonal.
moves.11... Qa5 12. O-O-O Rfc8: Black is ready to play b5, a5, b4 to open lines to the white king.
moves.13. Kb1: Moving the king to the safest square to attack from kingside.
moves.13... b5: ? This loses a pawn after 13Ncxb5 Qxd2 14.Bxd2 a5 15.a4 and white has the advantage and is a pawn up.
moves.20... Ng4 21. Bxf7+: 21.Bxf7+!! nice sacrifice that gives white big advantage.
moves.21... Kxf7 22. Rxh7+ Ke8:
The best. if instead 22...Kg8? 23.Rdh1 Rf8 (the only move to avoid mate) 24.Rh8+ Kf7 25.R1h7+ Ke8 26.Rxf8+ Kxf8 27.Rh8+ Kg7 28.Rxb8 wins easily.

 if 22...Kf8? 23.Rdh1 Be6 (forced to allow the king an escape at d7) 24.Nxe6+ Ke8 25.Rg7 Kd7 26.Rhh7 Re8 and white has a desicive advantage.
moves.23. Rh8+ Kf7 24. Rh7+: hoping for 24...Kg8 or Kf8 with quick win for white.
moves.24... Ke8: Here i refused draw by threefold repetition and continue the game as i have big advantage besides, i am white.
moves.25. Rdh1 Kd8: The only move that avoids mate or losing a material.
moves.28. Rgxe7+ Kb6 29. a3: better than an immediate f5 to avoid 29...a3!
moves.29... Ne3 30. f5 Nxg2 31. f6 Ne3 32. f7: 32. Bxf7? a mistake. better was Bc6 but white still have huge advantage.
moves.33. Rexf7 Nc4 34. Rf6 Nd2+ 35. Ka2 Nxe4: 38.Re7! i think black should resign here because he must lose the knight to avoid mate.
moves.39... Nd2: It seems ok , but now it is mate in 8 moves. {40.Rxd6+ Kc5 41.Red7 Rg6 42.Rxg6 Rc8 43.Rgd6 Kc4 44.Ne6 b4 45. Rb6 b3+ 46.Ka1 Nf3 47.Rd8#}.
moves.42. Ne6: Black resigns as mate is unavoidable.
